Configure Project/Journal File

Use the Configure Project dialog box (Admin | Configure Project | General Tab | Security | Journal File) to keep a journal file, which contains a record of the actions that users perform on archives. You can keep a journal file for each archive or a journal file for all archives within a project.

Field Descriptions

Security | Journal File
Journal File Do one of the following:

Select Do not keep a journal file to not keep a journal file.

Select Keep journal 'journal.vcs' in each archive directory to create a separate journal file for each archive, name it journal.vcs, and store it in the archive's directory.

Select Keep a journal file named to keep a single journal file for all archives of a project database or project.
If you specify a path but no name for the journal file, Version Manager names the file journal.vcs and places the journal file in the location you specified. If you do not specify a path with the file name, Version Manager places the journal file in the project database's or project's archive directory.

See Also

Setting Journal File Options Journal File Options
